pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [7c3f064bd5](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21770/commits/7c3f064bd5b0252b85a7c6682fe20b2df064b3b7)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.Frobenius` (new file)|2026|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ AddSubgroup.inertia`
`+ AddSubgroup.mem_inertia`
`+ AlgHom.IsArithFrobAt`
`+ CharP.dvd_of_ringHom`
`+ CharP.of_ringHom_of_ne_zero`
`+ IsArithFrobAt`
`+ _root_.arithFrobAt`
`+ _root_.isConj_arithFrobAt`
`+ apply_of_pow_eq_one`
`+ arithFrobAt`
`+ card_pos`
`+ comap_eq`
`+ conj`
`+ eq_of_isUnramifiedAt`
`+ existsUnique`
`+ exists_of_isInvariant`
`+ exists_pos`
`+ exists_primesOver_isConj`
`+ ext_of_iInf`
`+ finite_quotient`
`+ isArithFrobAt_localize`
`+ le_comap`
`+ localize`
`+ localize_algebraMap`
`+ mk'_neg`
`+ mk'_sub`
`+ mk_apply`
`+ mul_inv_mem_inertia`
`+ restrict`
`+ restrict_apply`
`+ restrict_injective`
`+ restrict_mk`
`+ «exists»`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
maintainer delegate
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by kbuzzard.

Thanks!

bors d+

:v: erdOne can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Thanks. I think this is the way to do things. Frobenii are really indexed by primes in the top field. We will need a theory which indexes them on primes in the bottom field though, especially when the field extension is infinite.

Thanks. I think this is the way to do things. Frobenii are really indexed by primes in the top field. We will need a theory which indexes them on primes in the bottom field though, especially when the field extension is infinite.

```suggestion
- `AlgHom.IsArithFrobAt`: We say that a `φ : S →ₐ[R] S` is an (arithmetic) frobenius at `Q`
```

```suggestion
  then `φ ζ = ζ ^ q` for any `m`-th root of unity `ζ` with `q ∤ m`.
```
Do you think this is crazy? Maybe we should have this notation in mathlib like we have `\notin`? Or does it cause trouble? (Remark: does this not render correctly on github? `∤`?
Works fine for vscode so I used it.

```suggestion
- `IsArithFrobAt`: We say that a `σ : G` is an (arithmetic) frobenius at `Q`
```
Does `Frobenius` have a capital F?

```suggestion
/-- The frobenius element at `Q` restricts to an automorphism of `S_Q`. -/
```

```suggestion
If `S/R` is unramified at `Q`, then the Frobenius `φ : S →ₐ[R] S` over `Q` is unique. -/
```
I keep reading and reading and it keeps being weird that Frobenius isn't capital. I think they should probably all be capitals.

```suggestion
`σ : M` is an (arithmetic) frobenius at an ideal `Q` of `S` if `σ • x ≡ x ^ q (mod Q)` for all `x`.
```
(etc etc)

```suggestion
the frobenius elements of `Q₁` and `Q₂` are conjugate if they lie over the same prime. -/
```

pullRequest.title: feat(RingTheory): frobenius elements
